items.title: Generic container for items in a dataset
items.description: A JSON array or object property containing one or more items in a dataset or data structure within a dataset.

doi.title: Digital Object Identifier
doi.description: A digital object identifier for or associated with a record. May be in the form of an HTTP url or a standalone identifier.

resolvable_identifier.title: Resolvable Identifier
resolvable_identifier.description: Some form of resolvable identifier for a record that returns a response when accessed over an included protocol such as HTTP. May or may not provide for content negotiation.

citation_string.title: Citation String
citation_string.description: A citation string directly associated with a resource record. Can be any parseable citation string.

record_date.title: The date that a record was considered valid from its source
record_date.description: A date supplied by a record source indicating when it was considered valid or current.

document_title.title: The title for a document of any type
document_title.description: A generic property used to hold the title for a document.

document_link.title: A web link (URL) to access a document online
document_link.description: A generic property used to hold a resolvable link to a document of any type.

publication_date.title: Date that a document or article was published
publication_date.description: A generic property used to hold a date at multiple levels of precision that a document or article was published.

date_created.title: Date Created
date_created.description: Date/time at various levels of precision and formatting that a record was created standardized from source information.

date_modified.title: Date Modified
date_modified.description: Date/time at various levels of precision and formatting that a record was modified standardized from source information.

biological_taxonomy.title: Biological Taxonomy
biological_taxonomy.description: An array containing the full taxonomic hierarchy for the subject taxon with rank and name standardized into a useful form from source data.

rank.title: Taxonomic Rank
rank.description: The specific rank in the taxonomic hierarchy.

name.title: Taxonomic Name
name.description: The scientific name at the hierarchical rank.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: An object or array that contains context-specific parameters as key/value pairs used as input to generate a record in a dataset.

processing_metadata.title: Object containing information about the processing of a record in a dataset
processing_metadata.description: A container object that contains properties describing the specific processing details for a given record within a dataset. Contains standardized properties describing the processing.

status.title: The overall status of the record processing step
status.description: Describes one of three standardized states for the processing of a given record.

date_processed.title: The data and time that the process for a given record was conducted
date_processed.description: Date time stamp in ISO8601 format denoting the point when the processing of the record occurred. Can be used to evaluate record currency with original source and trigger updates.

api.title: A resolvable API string used to obtain or generate a record in a dataset
api.description: Some form of resolvable Application Programming Interface such as a REST URL that was used to generate the record being documented. Often passed through a function of some kind to process the results.

status_message.title: Message with further details about the status of a record
status_message.description: Per dataset, this string contains context-specific details about the status or state of a record that was processed.

details.title: Data Processing Details
details.description: A list of statements describing additional specific details about the process of generating a record.

title: Dataset of species summary records from the IUCN Red List
description: A dataset containing summary records pulled from querying the IUCN Red List API. Items can indicate a negative search result. Contains a mix of higher level standard properties and custom properties. Data were assembled using a search function build into the experimental bispy software package (https://github.com/usgs-bcb/bispy).

Scientific Name.title: Scientific name for a biological species
Scientific Name.description: The scientific or latin name for a species that was used as an input parameter to an API

Name Source.title: Source of a name used as a parameter
Name Source.description: A string denoting the source for the scientific name used in the IUCN Red List search. Useful for determining the provenance of the name used.

iucn_species_summary.title: IUCN Red List Species Summary Container
iucn_species_summary.description: This container houses the summarized results for an IUCN Red List species when the species was found. Otherwise, it will be empty or not present.

iucn_taxonid.title: The numeric IUCN taxon ID
iucn_taxonid.description: The internal taxon identifier used in the IUCN Red List system. Used together with a secondary identifier to create a resolvable reference and as a key identifier through the IUCN Red List API.

iucn_status_code.title: The IUCN Conservation Status Code
iucn_status_code.description: The conservation status code for a species (ref: https://www.iucnredlist.org/resources/categories-and-criteria)

iucn_status_name.title: IUCN Status Name
iucn_status_name.description: The full name of the IUCN Red List Status (ref: https://www.iucnredlist.org/resources/categories-and-criteria).

iucn_population_trend.title: IUCN Red List Population Trend
iucn_population_trend.description: A categorical string indicating the overall trend for the population of a species.

iucn_secondary_identifier.title: A secondary identifier for a species record in the IUCN Red List
iucn_secondary_identifier.description: Secondary identifier extracted from a species citation string and used to generate a resolvable identifier.
